image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Victoria Police believe alleged gunman Dezi Freeman is being helped by people in the community, saying "people know the whereabouts of the person who has killed two cops".

title.children: Police believe 'people know' alleged gunman Dezi Freeman's whereabouts

image.altText: Tony Burke and David Adeang sit at a desk and sign documents.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says an agreement with Nauru to settle members of the so-called NZYQ cohort in exchange for hundreds of millions of dollars was not done in secret, but declined to elaborate on the arrangement.

title.children: Prime minister insists $408m deportation deal with Nauru not a 'secret'

image.altText: Afghan men carry on their shoulders the body of a woman earthquake victim, wrapped in black cloth.

props.synopsis: The 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit a mountainous area near Jalalabad, Afghanistan's fifth-largest city, late on Sunday night, with local officials appealing for international help.

title.children: Hundreds dead and thousands injured in Afghanistan earthquake

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman wearing a purple jacket speaks into a mic

props.synopsis: A suspected Russian interference attack disabled GPS navigation services at a Bulgarian airport impacting a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, according to Britain's Financial Times.

title.children: GPS of plane carrying EU president jammed over Bulgaria

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands and smile in front of two national flags

props.synopsis: The pair reportedly spoke for an hour one-on-one before the formal meeting began and held hands in front of the cameras.

title.children: Modi meets Putin in China as tensions simmer with US over Russian oil imports

image.altText: A stylised collage shows polaroid frames around photos of a young boy, and a young man at centre

props.synopsis: The ABC has obtained a voice recording of a WA police officer laughing about the suicide of an Aboriginal prisoner. It comes as new data shows the state has the highest rates of Indigenous deaths in custody in Australia.

title.children: Linton warned a police officer he was going to die, then when he did, she laughed

image.altText: A young boy crying next to three women sitting in outside next to a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says signatories to the genocide convention, including Australia, should prevent arms sales to Israel and uphold international law.

title.children: Leading scholars say Israel committing genocide in Gaza

image.altText: A group of people at a rally surrounded by Australian flags. Among them is a black megaphone with white symbols.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party distances itself from suspected far-right activists at a March for Australia rally in Townsville against immigration.

title.children: Katter says he was unaware man at rally was wearing neo-Nazi insignia

image.altText: A close up of an embryo being created with scientific equipment in a lab.

props.synopsis: A biracial baby was born to a white couple in Brisbane in an IVF mix-up that Australia's biggest fertility company kept secret for the past 11 years.

title.children: IVF clinic silenced couple who discovered donor mix-up when baby was born

image.altText: A sign in an ALDI store saying "we support Aussie farmers", full of vegetables.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission accuses growers of forming a cartel to fix prices of vegetables supplied to Aldi in three states.

title.children: ACCC accuses four Aldi vegetable suppliers of fixing prices

image.altText: An image of a phone screen with an image of a photo it snapped accompanied by a chunk of text

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is predicted to influence many sectors of work, and it is no longer a question of if, but how. Yet experts say the technology can also bring opportunities.

title.children: Here's what job sectors are most and least at risk from AI

image.altText: A middle-aged man in glasses sits indoors, near a man holding cash in his hand.

props.synopsis: A respected Queensland council worker suffered a career-ending psychiatric injury after the fake email, which referred to a Indigenous people as "dirty bastards", was tabled in parliament by an MP on an anti-corruption crusade.

title.children: Council ordered to pay millions over fabricated racist email

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin is determined to continue the bloodshed in Ukraine and has shown no interest in genuine peace talks, a top aide to Volodymyr Zelenskyy has claimed in an exclusive interview with the ABC.

title.children: This man has spoken to the Kremlin. He says Putin 'wants to keep war going'

image.altText: A young boy smiling

props.synopsis: The heartbroken parents of Jack Davey, a Melbourne schoolboy killed by an out-of-control car, say their lives have been destroyed by the devastating crash.

title.children: Parents of schoolboy Jack Davey say son's life was 'stolen' by driver

image.altText: Snoop Dogg

props.synopsis: Andrew Dillon is not concerned by the negative publicity surrounding the league's decision to hire controversial American rapper Snoop Dogg for its grand final entertainment.

title.children: 'He'll do a great job': AFL boss unmoved by Snoop Dogg grand final blow back

image.altText: A soy sauce container in the shape of a fish.

props.synopsis: South Australia has become the first state in Australia to ban fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers as it continues to phase out single-use plastics.

title.children: Nation-first ban on fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers begins in South Australia

image.altText: Shackled migrants deplane an aircraft as officials herd them down the stairs.

props.synopsis: Migrant children from Guatemala had already boarded planes in Texas when a federal judge in Washington DC halted their deportation.

title.children: Why has the US had to stop deportations of Guatemalan children?

image.altText: Aerial shots of a a large group of people dressed in Australian flag insignia rally

props.synopsis: Members of a neo-Nazi group who performed a "distasteful and inappropriate" chant at an anti-immigration rally in Perth at the weekend were not breaking the law, WA Police say.

title.children: Neo-Nazi chant at Perth anti-immigration rally did not break laws, say police

image.altText: A masked man wearing military combat camouflage gear.

props.synopsis: Since the war began, Abu Obeida had issued dozens of televised speeches, always appearing in military fatigues and a red keffiyeh scarf to obscure his face, and published audio messages, press releases and social media posts.

title.children: Hamas chief spokesperson killed in strikes, Israel says

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: Counter-terrorism police will help investigate an attack on a First Nations protest camp in Melbourne by far-right demonstrators that saw sticks and flagpoles used as weapons, Victoria's police minister says.

title.children: Counter-terrorism police reviewing attack on Indigenous gathering place

image.altText: Facebook photo of Adelaide man Glenn Holton.

props.synopsis: Glenn Holton was allegedly gunned down "callously and needlessly" on a suburban Adelaide street in December 2022 by his ex-girlfriend's new partner, Michael Craig Stanley, who is now standing trial accused of his murder.

title.children: Alleged murderer 'callously' shot girlfriend's ex-partner, jury told

image.altText: FILE PHOTO: Republican presidential nominee and former U.S. President Donald Trump holds a campaign rally in Novi, Michigan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's declaration that, "I have the right to do anything I want", didn't get the attention it deserved.

title.children: This authoritarian Trump statement didn't get the attention it deserves

image.altText: An Adelaide Crows player grimaces after an injury as a trainer supports his back as he checks his knee.

props.synopsis: A dynamic Adelaide forward loses his race against time to be fit for the qualifying final against Collingwood.

title.children: Crows rule out dynamic forward Rachele for Magpies final

image.altText: A man and a woman in running gear stand in front of an Aboriginal flag smiling.

props.synopsis: Charlie Maher has become the first Indigenous man to complete all seven major marathons in the world.

title.children: Indigenous runner Charlie Maher grateful for historic marathon feat

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Members of the multicultural community describe fear and hurt after the weekend's anti-immigration demonstrations, while experts raise concerns about far-right groups.

title.children: Experts say weekend anti-immigration rallies raise 'concerning development'

image.altText: A young boy walking on top of a monorail track

props.synopsis: A young boy was safely rescued at a Pennsylvania theme park after he was seen walking along an elevated monorail.

title.children: Young boy rescued after walking along elevated monorail track in Pennsylvania

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Documents reveal the scale of carbon pollution leaking from a Darwin LNG tank was like adding 8,300 new cars to the road every year. It is about to be filled again.

title.children: 'Huge' leak from gas plant kept secret from public in 'national scandal'

image.altText: Two men celebrate after scoring a try in an NRL match

props.synopsis: Canterbury have already changed up their attack with the addition of Lachlan Galvin and the benching of Reed Mahoney and now the Bulldogs are undergoing another tweak on the eve of the finals involving captain Stephen Crichton.

title.children: Bulldogs add another attacking change on eve of NRL finals

image.altText: tram at station

props.synopsis: The Queensland government dumps plans to build a multi-billion dollar public transport project on the Gold Coast, citing a cost blow out and "overwhelming opposition" from locals.

title.children: Qld dumps multi-billion dollar light rail due to 'overwhelming' opposition

image.altText: An aerial view of Alice Springs by night.

props.synopsis: The family of an Aboriginal man who died after being put in a "bear hug" is suing his Alice Springs disability care provider for negligence.

title.children: Aboriginal man died after carer put him in 'bear hug', family claims

image.altText: A young woman is packing clothes into a suitcase, sitting on a bed in a well-lit room

props.synopsis: Here's what experts have to say about the origins and value of these popular personality types.

title.children: Type A or Type B? Why we love to categorise ourselves

image.altText: Aerial shot of suburban streets of housing

props.synopsis: Australian property prices have been pushed higher again in August as lower interest rates, rising real wages and buyer optimism collided with a shortage of homes for sale.

title.children: House prices rising in 'seller's market' as new listings below average

image.altText: A composite image of four fair-skinned men, three of whom are in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Documents investigating the 2023 helicopter crash, today released by the government, identified failings by the Department of Defence.

title.children: Government releases some documents investigating 2023 Taipan crash

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Chinese national charged with reckless foreign interference indicates she'll fight the charge after entering a plea of not guilty in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Chinese national charged with foreign interference pleads not guilty

image.altText: An iPhone screen

props.synopsis: The study, which will inform the government's impending social media ban for under-16s, found several methods were viable, but no method was foolproof, with concerns over both accuracy and privacy.

title.children: Social media age verification possible but laden with risks, study warns
